metadata.title: CVE-2021-27363 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.3. A kernelpointer leak can be used to determine the address of the iscsi_transportstructure. When an iSCSI transport is registered with the iSCSI subsystem,the transport's handle is available to unprivileged users via the sysfsfile system, at /sys/class/iscsi_transport/$TRANSPORT_NAME/handle. Whenread, the show_transport_handle function (indrivers/scsi/scsi_transport_iscsi.c) is called, which leaks the handle.This handle is actually the pointer to an iscsi_transport struct in thekernel module's global variables.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27363` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1148-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1148.158
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1152-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1152.162
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-206.238').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1090.99').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1124.138').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1096.103~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1110.122~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1095.108~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1067.75~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1148.158').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1152.162').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
